<li id="cite&#95;note-194"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-194">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFChiodoOwyang2002" class="citation journal cs1">Chiodo, Abbigail J.; Owyang, Michael T. <li id="cite&#95;note-206"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-206">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFEmerson2008" class="citation journal cs1">Emerson, Michael (2008). </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-207"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-207">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.france24.com/en/20081119-moscow-edges-towards-six-year-presidential-terms-russia">"Moscow edges towards six-year presidential terms"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/France_24" title="France 24">France 24</a></i>. 19 November 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-237"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-237">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.britannica.com/place/Europe/Land#ref34534">"Europe  Land"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopdia Britannica">Encyclopdia Britannica</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220315194552/https://www.britannica.com/place/Europe/Land#ref34534">Archived</a> from the original on 15 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">4 April</span> 2022</span>. <q>The lowest terrain in Europe, virtually lacking relief, stands at the head of the Caspian Sea; there the Caspian Depression reaches some 95 feet (29 metres) below sea level.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Europe+%E2%80%93+Land&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Britannica&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.britannica.com%2Fplace%2FEurope%2FLand%23ref34534&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite&#95;note-climate-250"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-climate_250-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-climate_250-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-climate_250-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-climate_250-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cbd.int/countries/profile/?country=ru">"Russian Federation  Main Details"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Convention_on_Biological_Diversity" title="Convention on Biological Diversity">Convention on Biological Diversity</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220408173651/https://www.cbd.int/countries/profile/?country=ru">Archived</a> from the original on 8 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-Gardiner-2021-251"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Gardiner-2021_251-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFGardiner2021" class="citation web cs1">Gardiner, Beth (23 March 2021). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://e360.yale.edu/features/will-russias-forests-be-an-asset-or-obstacle-in-the-climate-fight">"Will Russia's Forests Be an Asset or an Obstacle in Climate Fight?"</a>. <i>Yale University</i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20221211140422/https://e360.yale.edu/features/will-russias-forests-be-an-asset-or-obstacle-in-the-climate-fight">Archived</a> from the original on 11 December 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-266"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-266">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFReuter2010" class="citation journal cs1">Reuter, Ora John (March 2010). <li id="cite&#95;note-272"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-272">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFRagsdale2016" class="citation book cs1">Ragsdale, Hugh (16 September 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=WrYYDQAAQBAJ"><i>The Russian Tragedy: The Burden of History</i></a>. Routledge. pp.&#160;<span class="nowrap">18</span>20, <span class="nowrap">162</span>163. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-315-48079-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-315-48079-4"><bdi>978-1-315-48079-4</bdi></a>. <q>The revolution that Ivan accomplished was the great watershed of Russian political tradition. Ivan's statecraft was the great prototype, a classic Russian system of absolutism and militarism under cautious and scrupulous control... Ivan III laid the foundations of Russian absolutism... In a serious break with tradition, Russia entered the constitutional era... Russian autocracy came to an end, and the Revolution of 1905 soon withered and diednot, however, without fateful consequences.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Russian+Tragedy%3A+The+Burden+of+History&amp;rft.pages=18-20%2C+162-163&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2016-09-16&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-315-48079-4&amp;rft.aulast=Ragsdale&amp;rft.aufirst=Hugh&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DWrYYDQAAQBAJ&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-t305-278"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-t305_278-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-t305_278-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKallmer2023" class="citation web cs1">Kallmer, Brent (6 April 2023). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/articles/the-putin-myth/#f3-text">"The Putin Myth"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Journal_of_Democracy" title="Journal of Democracy">Journal of Democracy</a> - <a href="/wiki/Johns_Hopkins_University_Press" title="Johns Hopkins University Press">Johns Hopkins University Press</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20241221070113/https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/articles/the-putin-myth/#f3-text">Archived</a> from the original on 21 December 2024<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-280"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-280">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFChapman2024" class="citation journal cs1">Chapman, Hannah S. <li id="cite&#95;note-290"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-290">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKARTASHKINABASHIDZE2004" class="citation journal cs1">KARTASHKIN, V.A.; ABASHIDZE, A.KH. (2004). "Autonomy in the Russian Federation: Theory and Practice". <i>International Journal on Minority and Group Rights</i>. <b>10</b> (3). <a href="/wiki/Brill_Publishers" title="Brill Publishers">Brill</a>: <span class="nowrap">203</span>220. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1163%2F1571811031310738">10.1163/1571811031310738</a>. <a href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/24675138">24675138</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=International+Journal+on+Minority+and+Group+Rights&amp;rft.atitle=Autonomy+in+the+Russian+Federation%3A+Theory+and+Practice&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=203-220&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1163%2F1571811031310738&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F24675138%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.aulast=KARTASHKIN&amp;rft.aufirst=V.A.&amp;rft.au=ABASHIDZE%2C+A.KH.&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-gambit-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-gambit_303-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-gambit_303-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFJintro2025" class="citation journal cs1">Jintro, Pauly (February 2025). Bunde, Tobias; Eisentraut, Sophie; Schtte, Leonard (eds.). "Russia: The Czar's Gambit". <i>Munich Security Report 2025: Multipolarization</i>. <a href="/wiki/Munich_Security_Conference" title="Munich Security Conference">Munich Security Conference</a>: <span class="nowrap">79</span>85. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.47342%2FEZUC8623-5">10.47342/EZUC8623-5</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Munich+Security+Report+2025%3A+Multipolarization&amp;rft.atitle=Russia%3A+The+Czar%27s+Gambit&amp;rft.pages=79-85&amp;rft.date=2025-02&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.47342%2FEZUC8623-5&amp;rft.aulast=Jintro&amp;rft.aufirst=Pauly&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-304"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-304">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFSweijsDe&#95;Spiegeleirede&#95;JongOosterveld2017" class="citation book cs1">Sweijs, T.; De Spiegeleire, S.; de Jong, S.; Oosterveld, W.; Roos, H.; Bekkers, F.; Usanov, A.; de Rave, R.; Jans, K. (2017). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=1EonDwAAQBAJ"><i>Volatility and friction in the age of disintermediation</i></a>. The Hague Centre for Strategic Studies. p.&#160;43. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-94-92102-46-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-94-92102-46-1"><bdi>978-94-92102-46-1</bdi></a>. <q>We qualify the following states as great powers: China, Europe, India, Japan, Russia and the United States.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Volatility+and+friction+in+the+age+of+disintermediation&amp;rft.pages=43&amp;rft.pub=The+Hague+Centre+for+Strategic+Studies&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=978-94-92102-46-1&amp;rft.aulast=Sweijs&amp;rft.aufirst=T.&amp;rft.au=De+Spiegeleire%2C+S.&amp;rft.au=de+Jong%2C+S.&amp;rft.au=Oosterveld%2C+W.&amp;rft.au=Roos%2C+H.&amp;rft.au=Bekkers%2C+F.&amp;rft.au=Usanov%2C+A.&amp;rft.au=de+Rave%2C+R.&amp;rft.au=Jans%2C+K.&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D1EonDwAAQBAJ&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-l454-305"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-l454_305-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFEllman2023" class="citation journal cs1">Ellman, Michael (2023). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1017%2FS1744137422000388">"Russia as a great power: from 1815 to the present day. <li id="cite&#95;note-306"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-306">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFNeumann2008" class="citation journal cs1">Neumann, Iver B (20 May 2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1057%2Fjird.2008.7">"Russia as a Great Power, 18152007"</a>. <i>Journal of International Relations and Development</i>. <b>11</b> (11): <span class="nowrap">128</span>151. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1057%2Fjird.2008.7">10.1057/jird.2008.7</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+International+Relations+and+Development&amp;rft.atitle=Russia+as+a+Great+Power%2C+1815%E2%80%932007&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=11&amp;rft.pages=128-151&amp;rft.date=2008-05-20&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1057%2Fjird.2008.7&amp;rft.aulast=Neumann&amp;rft.aufirst=Iver+B&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1057%252Fjird.2008.7&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-307"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-307">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFTaylor2024" class="citation book cs1">Taylor, Brian D. (2024). "Power, status, and greatness". <i>Russian Politics: A Very Short Introduction</i>. Oxford University Press. pp.&#160;<span class="nowrap">21</span>40. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Factrade%2F9780197516027.003.0002">10.1093/actrade/9780197516027.003.0002</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-751602-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-751602-7"><bdi>978-0-19-751602-7</bdi></a>. <q>Although the lines sometimes can be blurry, there are only three countries in the world that international relations experts typically classify as having been a great power for the past 300 years: Britain, France, and Russia... Russia's geographic size, nuclear weapons, and permanent UN Security Council seat guarantee its continuing great power status... Yet the greater economic power of the United States, the European Union, and China, as well as rising countries... meant that Russia's future standing in the world remained in doubt even before the Russo-Ukraine War.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Power%2C+status%2C+and+greatness&amp;rft.btitle=Russian+Politics%3A+A+Very+Short+Introduction&amp;rft.pages=21-40&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2024&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Factrade%2F9780197516027.003.0002&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-751602-7&amp;rft.aulast=Taylor&amp;rft.aufirst=Brian+D.&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-f495-308"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-f495_308-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFepanovi2023" class="citation journal cs1">epanovi, Janko (22 March 2023). "Still a great power? Russia's status dilemmas post-Ukraine war". <i>Journal of Contemporary European Studies</i>. <b>32</b> (1). Informa UK Limited: <span class="nowrap">80</span>95. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F14782804.2023.2193878">10.1080/14782804.2023.2193878</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://search.worldcat.org/issn/1478-2804">1478-2804</a>. <q>Drezner, as well as others like Dan Depetris, agrees that, on principle, Russia can still be counted among the great powers... At the same time, scholars rightly wonder what rank within the great power club Russia belongs to...</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Contemporary+European+Studies&amp;rft.atitle=Still+a+great+power%3F+Russia%27s+status+dilemmas+post-Ukraine+war&amp;rft.volume=32&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=80-95&amp;rft.date=2023-03-22&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F14782804.2023.2193878&amp;rft.issn=1478-2804&amp;rft.aulast=%C5%A0%C4%87epanovi%C4%87&amp;rft.aufirst=Janko&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-309"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-309">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFFishSamarinWay2017" class="citation journal cs1"><a href="/wiki/Steven_Fish" title="Steven Fish">Fish, M. <li id="cite&#95;note-315"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-315">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFHancock2006" class="citation journal cs1">Hancock, Kathleen J. (April 2006). "The Semi-Sovereign State: Belarus and the Russian Neo-Empire". <i><a href="/wiki/Foreign_Policy_Analysis_(journal)" title="Foreign Policy Analysis (journal)">Foreign Policy Analysis</a></i>. <b>2</b> (2). <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>: <span class="nowrap">117</span>136. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1111%2Fj.1743-8594.2006.00023.x">10.1111/j.1743-8594.2006.00023.x</a>. <a href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/24907272">24907272</a>. <a href="/wiki/SSRN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="SSRN (identifier)">SSRN</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1949519">1949519</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Foreign+Policy+Analysis&amp;rft.atitle=The+Semi-Sovereign+State%3A+Belarus+and+the+Russian+Neo-Empire&amp;rft.volume=2&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=117-136&amp;rft.date=2006-04&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F24907272%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fpapers.ssrn.com%2Fsol3%2Fpapers.cfm%3Fabstract&#95;id%3D1949519%23id-name%3DSSRN&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1111%2Fj.1743-8594.2006.00023.x&amp;rft.aulast=Hancock&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathleen+J.&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-Kolst-320"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kolst_320-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKolst2011" class="citation journal cs1">Kolst, Pl (July 2011). "Central Asia and Russian Relations: Breaking Out of the Russian Orbit?". <i><a href="/wiki/Brown_Journal_of_World_Affairs" title="Brown Journal of World Affairs">Brown Journal of World Affairs</a></i>. <b>19</b> (1): <span class="nowrap">101</span>113. <a href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/24590931">24590931</a>. <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><a href="/wiki/ProQuest" title="ProQuest">ProQuest</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.proquest.com/docview/1326331335">1326331335</a>. <q>The Central Asian states have been dependent on Russia since they gained independence in 1991, not just in economic and energy terms, but also militarily and politically.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Brown+Journal+of+World+Affairs&amp;rft.atitle=Central+Asia+and+Russian+Relations%3A+Breaking+Out+of+the+Russian+Orbit%3F&amp;rft.volume=19&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=101-113&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F24590931%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.aulast=Swanstr%C3%B6m&amp;rft.aufirst=Niklas&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-326">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/2/24/ukraine-breaks-diplomatic-ties-with-russia">"Ukraine cuts diplomatic ties with Russia after invasion"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Al_Jazeera_Media_Network" title="Al Jazeera Media Network">Al Jazeera</a></i>. 24 February 2022. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220305163901/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/2/24/ukraine-breaks-diplomatic-ties-with-russia">Archived</a> from the original on 5 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-327"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-327">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKanerva2018" class="citation journal cs1">Kanerva, Ilkka (2018). "Russia and the West". <i>Horizons: Journal of International Relations and Sustainable Development</i> (12). <li id="cite&#95;note-340"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-340">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFFeinsteinPirro2021" class="citation journal cs1">Feinstein, Scott G.; Pirro, Ellen B. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-341"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-341">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFMahairasDvilyanski2018" class="citation journal cs1">Mahairas, Aristedes; Dvilyanski, Mikhail (2018). <li id="cite&#95;note-355"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-355">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFWezemanDjokicGeorgeHussain2025" class="citation journal cs1">Wezeman, Pieter D.; Djokic, Katarina; George, Mathew; Hussain, Zain; Wezeman, Siemon T. <li id="cite&#95;note-367"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-367">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFGerberMendelson2008" class="citation journal cs1">Gerber, Theodore P.; <a href="/wiki/Sarah_E._Mendelson" title="Sarah E. <li id="cite&#95;note-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-425">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFRussell2018" class="citation journal cs1">Russell, Martin (April 2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.europarl.europa.eu/RegData/etudes/ATAG/2018/620225/EPRS_ATA(2018)620225_EN.pdf">"Socioeconomic inequality in Russia"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i><a href="/wiki/European_Parliamentary_Research_Service" title="European Parliamentary Research Service">European Parliamentary Research Service</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/European_Parliament" title="European Parliament">European Parliament</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220217150505/https://www.europarl.europa.eu/RegData/etudes/ATAG/2018/620225/EPRS_ATA(2018)620225_EN.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 17 February 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-reutersunem-437"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-reutersunem_437-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFMarrowKorsunskaya2024" class="citation web cs1">Marrow, Alexander; Korsunskaya, Darya (5 June 2024). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/soaring-wages-record-low-unemployment-underscore-russias-labour-squeeze-2024-06-05/">"Soaring wages, record-low unemployment underscore Russia's labour squeeze"</a>. <i>Reuters</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">4 August</span> 2024</span>. <q>Russia's unemployment rate dropped to a record-low 2.6% in April and real wages soared in March, data published by the federal statistics service showed on Wednesday, highlighting the extent of Russia's tight labour market.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Reuters&amp;rft.atitle=Soaring+wages%2C+record-low+unemployment+underscore+Russia%27s+labour+squeeze&amp;rft.date=2024-06-05&amp;rft.aulast=Marrow&amp;rft.aufirst=Alexander&amp;rft.au=Korsunskaya%2C+Darya&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reuters.com%2Fmarkets%2Feurope%2Fsoaring-wages-record-low-unemployment-underscore-russias-labour-squeeze-2024-06-05%2F&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-450"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-450">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bp.com/content/dam/bp/business-sites/en/global/corporate/pdfs/energy-economics/statistical-review/bp-stats-review-2020-full-report.pdf">"Statistical Review of World Energy 69th edition"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>bp.com</i>. <a href="/wiki/BP" title="BP">BP</a>. 2020. p.&#160;45. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200919060352/https://www.bp.com/content/dam/bp/business-sites/en/global/corporate/pdfs/energy-economics/statistical-review/bp-stats-review-2020-full-report.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 19 September 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-451"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-451">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230326013732/https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/field/crude-oil-proved-reserves/country-comparison/">"Crude oil  proved reserves"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency" title="Central Intelligence Agency">Central Intelligence Agency</a>. <li id="cite&#95;note-471"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-471">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFLustgarten2020" class="citation news cs1">Lustgarten, Abrahm (16 December 2020). <span class="id-lock-limited" title="Free access subject to limited trial, subscription normally required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/12/16/magazine/russia-climate-migration-crisis.html">"How Russia Wins the Climate Crisis"</a></span>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220414034549/https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/12/16/magazine/russia-climate-migration-crisis.html">Archived</a> from the original on 14 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 June</span> 2021</span>. <q>Across Eastern Russia, wild forests, swamps and grasslands are slowly being transformed into orderly grids of soybeans, corn and wheat. <li id="cite&#95;note-486"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-486">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFGordon2016" class="citation journal cs1">Gordon, Siamon (3 February 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6738810">"Elie Metchnikoff, the Man and the Myth"</a>. <i>Journal of Innate Immunity</i>. <b>8</b> (3): <span class="nowrap">223</span>227. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1159%2F000443331">10.1159/000443331</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a>&#160;<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6738810">6738810</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26836137">26836137</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Innate+Immunity&amp;rft.atitle=Elie+Metchnikoff%2C+the+Man+and+the+Myth&amp;rft.volume=8&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=223-227&amp;rft.date=2016-02-03&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6738810%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Apmid%2F26836137&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1159%2F000443331&amp;rft.aulast=Gordon&amp;rft.aufirst=Siamon&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6738810&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-487"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-487">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFAnrep1936" class="citation journal cs1">Anrep, G. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-488"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-488">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFGorelik1997" class="citation journal cs1">Gorelik, Gennady (August 1997). "The Top-Secret Life of Lev Landau". <i><a href="/wiki/Scientific_American" title="Scientific American">Scientific American</a></i>. <b>277</b> (2). <li id="cite&#95;note-501"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-501">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFAvduevskyYa&#95;MarovRozhdestvenskyBorodin1971" class="citation journal cs1">Avduevsky, V. S.; Ya Marov, M.; Rozhdestvensky, M. K.; Borodin, N. F.; Kerzhanovich, V. V. (1 March 1971). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1175%2F1520-0469%281971%29028%3C0263%3ASLOVOT%3E2.0.CO%3B2">"Soft Landing of Venera 7 on the Venus Surface and Preliminary Results of Investigations of the Venus Atmosphere"</a>. <i>Journal of the Atmospheric Sciences</i>. <b>28</b> (2). Moscow: <a href="/wiki/Academy_of_Sciences_of_the_Soviet_Union" title="Academy of Sciences of the Soviet Union">Academy of Sciences of the Soviet Union</a>: <span class="nowrap">263</span>269. <a href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/1971JAtS...28..263A">1971JAtS...28..263A</a>. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1175%2F1520-0469%281971%29028%3C0263%3ASLOVOT%3E2.0.CO%3B2">10.1175/1520-0469(1971)028&#60;0263:SLOVOT&#62;2.0.CO&#59;2</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+the+Atmospheric+Sciences&amp;rft.atitle=Soft+Landing+of+Venera+7+on+the+Venus+Surface+and+Preliminary+Results+of+Investigations+of+the+Venus+Atmosphere&amp;rft.volume=28&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=263-269&amp;rft.date=1971-03-01&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1175%2F1520-0469%281971%29028%3C0263%3ASLOVOT%3E2.0.CO%3B2&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Abibcode%2F1971JAtS...28..263A&amp;rft.aulast=Avduevsky&amp;rft.aufirst=V.+S.&amp;rft.au=Ya+Marov%2C+M.&amp;rft.au=Rozhdestvensky%2C+M.+K.&amp;rft.au=Borodin%2C+N.+F.&amp;rft.au=Kerzhanovich%2C+V.+V.&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1175%252F1520-0469%25281971%2529028%253C0263%253ASLOVOT%253E2.0.CO%253B2&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-514"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-514">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/545/">"Kremlin and Red Square, Moscow"</a>. <i>UNESCO World Heritage Centre</i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211109165341/https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/545/">Archived</a> from the original on 9 November 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-2021census-515"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2021census_515-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFRussian&#95;Federal&#95;State&#95;Statistics&#95;Service" class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source">Russian Federal State Statistics Service. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://rosstat.gov.ru/vpn/2020/Tom1_Chislennost_i_razmeshchenie_naseleniya"><bdi lang="ru">   2020 .  1</bdi></a> &#91;2020 All-Russian Population Census, vol. 1&#93; <span class="cs1-format">(XLS)</span> (in Russian). <a href="/wiki/Federal_State_Statistics_Service_(Russia)" class="mw-redirect" title="Federal State Statistics Service (Russia)">Federal State Statistics Service</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%D0%92%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F+%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BF%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%8C+%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%81%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8F+2020+%D0%B3%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%B0.+%D0%A2%D0%BE%D0%BC+1&amp;rft.pub=Federal+State+Statistics+Service&amp;rft.au=Russian+Federal+State+Statistics+Service&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Frosstat.gov.ru%2Fvpn%2F2020%2FTom1&#95;Chislennost&#95;i&#95;razmeshchenie&#95;naseleniya&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-520"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-520">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKoehn2011" class="citation web cs1">Koehn, Jodi (7 July 2011). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.wilsoncenter.org/publication/russias-demographic-crisis">"Russia's Demographic Crisis"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Kennan_Institute" title="Kennan Institute">Kennan Institute</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson_International_Center_for_Scholars" class="mw-redirect" title="Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars">Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170705223345/https://www.wilsoncenter.org/publication/russias-demographic-crisis">Archived</a> from the original on 5 July 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-521"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-521">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFFoltynova2020" class="citation web cs1">Foltynova, Kristyna (19 June 2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.rferl.org/a/migrants-welcome-is-russia-trying-to-solve-its-demographic-crisis-by-attracting-foreigners-/30677952.html">"Migrants Welcome: Is Russia Trying To Solve Its Demographic Crisis By Attracting Foreigners?"</a>. Radio Liberty. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200620034801/https://www.rferl.org/a/migrants-welcome-is-russia-trying-to-solve-its-demographic-crisis-by-attracting-foreigners-/30677952.html">Archived</a> from the original on 20 June 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 July</span> 2021</span>. <q>Russia has been trying to boost fertility rates and reduce death rates for several years now. Special programs for families have been implemented, anti-tobacco campaigns have been organised, and raising the legal age to buy alcohol was considered. However, perhaps the most successful strategy so far has been attracting migrants, whose arrival helps Russia to compensate population losses.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Migrants+Welcome%3A+Is+Russia+Trying+To+Solve+Its+Demographic+Crisis+By+Attracting+Foreigners%3F&amp;rft.pub=Radio+Liberty&amp;rft.date=2020-06-19&amp;rft.aulast=Foltynova&amp;rft.aufirst=Kristyna&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rferl.org%2Fa%2Fmigrants-welcome-is-russia-trying-to-solve-its-demographic-crisis-by-attracting-foreigners-%2F30677952.html&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-522"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-522">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFSaver2021" class="citation web cs1">Saver, Pjotr (13 October 2021). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/oct/13/russias-population-undergoes-largest-ever-peacetime-decline">"Russia's population undergoes largest ever peacetime decline, analysis shows"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Guardian" title="The Guardian">The Guardian</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211013112949/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/oct/13/russias-population-undergoes-largest-ever-peacetime-decline">Archived</a> from the original on 13 October 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-529"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-529">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.britannica.com/place/Russia/Mixed-and-deciduous-forest#ref38597">"Russia  The Indo-European Group"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopdia Britannica">Encyclopdia Britannica</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201112023228/https://www.britannica.com/place/Russia/Mixed-and-deciduous-forest#ref38597">Archived</a> from the original on 12 November 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-530"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-530">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKowalevNeznaika2000" class="citation journal cs1">Kowalev, Viktor; Neznaika, Pavel (2000). <li id="cite&#95;note-535"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-535">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFLazarevPravikova2005" class="citation conference cs1">Lazarev, Vladimir; Pravikova, Ludmila (2005). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.lingref.com/isb/4/103ISB4.PDF">"The North Caucasus Bilingualism and Language Identity"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite&#95;note-language-536"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-language_536-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-language_536-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://learn.utoronto.ca/programs-courses/languages-and-translation/language-learning/russian">"Russian"</a>. <a href="/wiki/University_of_Toronto" title="University of Toronto">University of Toronto</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190628022427/https://learn.utoronto.ca/programs-courses/languages-and-translation/language-learning/russian">Archived</a> from the original on 28 June 2019<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 July</span> 2021</span>. <q>Russian is the most widespread of the Slavic languages and the largest native language in Europe. <li id="cite&#95;note-537"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-537">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFWakata" class="citation web cs1"><a href="/wiki/Koichi_Wakata" title="Koichi Wakata">Wakata, Koichi</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://global.jaxa.jp/article/special/expedition/wakata01_e.html">"My Long Mission in Space"</a>. <a href="/wiki/JAXA" title="JAXA">JAXA</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140426232353/https://global.jaxa.jp/article/special/expedition/wakata01_e.html">Archived</a> from the original on 26 April 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-538"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-538">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFIryna2011" class="citation journal cs1">Iryna, Ulasiuk (2011). "Legal protection of linguistic diversity in Russia: past and present". <i><a href="/wiki/Journal_of_Multilingual_and_Multicultural_Development" title="Journal of Multilingual and Multicultural Development">Journal of Multilingual and Multicultural Development</a></i>. <b>32</b> (1). <a href="/wiki/European_University_Institute" title="European University Institute">European University Institute</a>: <span class="nowrap">71</span>83. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F01434632.2010.536237">10.1080/01434632.2010.536237</a>. <q>Russia is unique in its size and ethnic composition. There is a further linguistic complexity of more than 150 co-existing languages.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Multilingual+and+Multicultural+Development&amp;rft.atitle=Legal+protection+of+linguistic+diversity+in+Russia%3A+past+and+present&amp;rft.volume=32&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=71-83&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F01434632.2010.536237&amp;rft.aulast=Iryna&amp;rft.aufirst=Ulasiuk&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-539"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-539">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.britannica.com/place/Russia/Mixed-and-deciduous-forest#ref38595">"Russia  Ethnic groups and languages"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopdia Britannica">Encyclopdia Britannica</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201112023228/https://www.britannica.com/place/Russia/Mixed-and-deciduous-forest#ref38595">Archived</a> from the original on 12 November 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">8 November</span> 2020</span>. <q>Although ethnic Russians comprise more than four-fifths of the country's total population, Russia is a diverse, multiethnic society. More than 120 ethnic groups, many with their own national territories, speaking some 100 languages live within Russia's borders.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Russia+%E2%80%93+Ethnic+groups+and+languages&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Britannica&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.britannica.com%2Fplace%2FRussia%2FMixed-and-deciduous-forest%23ref38595&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-540"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-540">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220307194352/http://www.gks.ru/free_doc/new_site/perepis2010/croc/perepis_itogi1612.htm"><bdi lang="ru">   2010 </bdi></a> &#91;All-Russian population census 2010&#93;. <i> 4.     , </i> (in Russian). <a href="/wiki/Rosstat" class="mw-redirect" title="Rosstat">Rosstat</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.gks.ru/free_doc/new_site/perepis2010/croc/perepis_itogi1612.htm">the original</a> on 7 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-541"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-541">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.constitution.ru/en/10003000-04.htm">"Chapter 3. The Federal Structure"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Russia" title="Constitution of Russia">Constitution of Russia</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181225132251/http://www.constitution.ru/en/10003000-04.htm">Archived</a> from the original on 25 December 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 December</span> 2007</span>. <q>2. The Republics shall have the right to establish their own state languages. In the bodies of state authority and local self-government, state institutions of the Republics they shall be used together with the state language of the Russian Federation. 3. The Russian Federation shall guarantee to all of its peoples the right to preserve their native language and to create conditions for its study and development.</q></cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Chapter+3.+The+Federal+Structure&amp;rft.pub=Constitution+of+Russia&amp;rft&#95;id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.constitution.ru%2Fen%2F10003000-04.htm&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-542"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-542">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFJankiewiczKnyagininaPrina2020" class="citation journal cs1">Jankiewicz, Szymon; Knyaginina, Nadezhda; Prina, Federic (13 March 2020). </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-543"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-543">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFBondarenkoNasonkinShagievaKiyanova2018" class="citation journal cs1">Bondarenko, Dmitry V.; Nasonkin, Vladimir V.; Shagieva, Rozalina V.; Kiyanova, Olga N.; Barabanova, Svetlana V. <li id="cite&#95;note-550"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-550">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFFoltz2019" class="citation journal cs1"><a href="/wiki/Richard_Foltz" title="Richard Foltz">Foltz, Richard</a> (2019). "Scythian Neo-Paganism in the Caucasus: The Ossetian Uatsdin as a 'Nature Religion'<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>". <i>Journal for the Study of Religion, Nature, and Culture</i>. <b>13</b> (3): <span class="nowrap">314</span>332. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1558%2Fjsrnc.39114">10.1558/jsrnc.39114</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+for+the+Study+of+Religion%2C+Nature%2C+and+Culture&amp;rft.atitle=Scythian+Neo-Paganism+in+the+Caucasus%3A+The+Ossetian+Uatsdin+as+a+%27Nature+Religion%27&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=314-332&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1558%2Fjsrnc.39114&amp;rft.aulast=Foltz&amp;rft.aufirst=Richard&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-551"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-551">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFAndreeva2012" class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source">Andreeva, Julia Olegovna (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200806200229/https://www.kunstkamera.ru/files/lib/978-5-88431-204-3/978-5-88431-204-3_14.pdf">"      '  '<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a> &#91;Representations of national traditions in the movement 'Ringing Cedars of Russia'&#93; <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. In T. B. Shchepanskaya (ed.). <i>      :   </i> &#91;<i>Prospects of the future in ethnographic and folklore materials: Collection of scientific articles</i>&#93; (in Russian). Saint Petersburg: <a href="/wiki/Kunstkamera" title="Kunstkamera">Kunstkamera</a>. pp.&#160;<span class="nowrap">231</span>245. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.kunstkamera.ru/files/lib/978-5-88431-204-3/978-5-88431-204-3_14.pdf">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 6 August 2020.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B4%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8F+%D0%BE+%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%BD%D1%8B%D1%85+%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%8F%D1%85+%D0%B2+%D0%B4%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B8+%27%D0%97%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%8F%D1%89%D0%B8%D0%B5+%D0%BA%D0%B5%D0%B4%D1%80%D1%8B+%D0%A0%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%B8%27&amp;rft.btitle=%D0%90%D1%81%D0%BF%D0%B5%D0%BA%D1%82%D1%8B+%D0%B1%D1%83%D0%B4%D1%83%D1%89%D0%B5%D0%B3%D0%BE+%D0%BF%D0%BE+%D1%8D%D1%82%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B3%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%84%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%BC+%D0%B8+%D1%84%D0%BE%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%BB%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%BC+%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%BC%3A+%D1%81%D0%B1%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BA+%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%83%D1%87%D0%BD%D1%8B%D1%85+%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%B9&amp;rft.place=Saint+Petersburg&amp;rft.pages=231-245&amp;rft.pub=Kunstkamera&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.aulast=Andreeva&amp;rft.aufirst=Julia+Olegovna&amp;rft&#95;id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.kunstkamera.ru%2Ffiles%2Flib%2F978-5-88431-204-3%2F978-5-88431-204-3&#95;14.pdf&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-575"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-575">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.DYN.LE00.IN?locations=RU">"Life expectancy at birth, total (years) - Russian Federation"</a>. <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" class="mw-redirect" title="World Bank">World Bank</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230606000827/https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.DYN.LE00.IN?locations=RU">Archived</a> from the original on 6 June 2023<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-576"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-576">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://data.who.int/countries/643">"Russian Federation"</a>. <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a> (WHO)<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>

<li id="cite&#95;note-585"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-585">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFRadaevRoschina2025" class="citation journal cs1">Radaev, Vadim; Roschina, Yana (7 August 2025). <li id="cite&#95;note-586"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-586">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFThe&#95;Lancet2019" class="citation journal cs1">The Lancet (5 October 2019). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2819%2932265-2">"Russia's alcohol policy: a continuing success story"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Lancet" title="The Lancet">The Lancet</a></i>. <b>394</b> (10205): 1205. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2819%2932265-2">10.1016/S0140-6736(19)32265-2</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31591968">31591968</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Lancet&amp;rft.atitle=Russia%27s+alcohol+policy%3A+a+continuing+success+story&amp;rft.volume=394&amp;rft.issue=10205&amp;rft.pages=1205&amp;rft.date=2019-10-05&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2819%2932265-2&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Apmid%2F31591968&amp;rft.au=The+Lancet&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1016%252FS0140-6736%252819%252932265-2&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-587"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-587">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.who.int/europe/news/item/01-10-2019-alcohol-related-deaths-drop-in-russian-federation-due-to-strict-alcohol-control-measures-new-report-says">"Alcohol-related deaths drop in Russian Federation due to strict alcohol control measures, new report says"</a>. <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" class="mw-redirect" title="World Bank">World Bank</a>. 1 October 2019<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-Bulgakova-2012-600"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Bulgakova-2012_600-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Bulgakova-2012_600-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Bulgakova-2012_600-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Bulgakova-2012_600-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFBulgakova2012" class="citation web cs1">Bulgakova, Oksana (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://digitalscholarship.unlv.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1021&amp;context=russian_culture">"The Russian Cinematic Culture"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 January</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Russian+Cinematic+Culture&amp;rft.pages=1-37&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Nevada%2C+Las+Vegas&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.aulast=Bulgakova&amp;rft.aufirst=Oksana&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fdigitalscholarship.unlv.edu%2Fcgi%2Fviewcontent.cgi%3Farticle%3D1021%26context%3Drussian&#95;culture&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite&#95;note-614"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-614">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.euronews.com/2020/05/01/in-pictures-may-day-through-history">"In pictures: May Day through history"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Euronews" title="Euronews">Euronews</a></i>. 1 May 2020. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220408132439/https://www.euronews.com/2020/05/01/in-pictures-may-day-through-history">Archived</a> from the original on 8 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-628"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-628">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFBrunson2016" class="citation book cs1">Brunson, Molly (2016). <i>Russian Realisms</i>. <li id="cite&#95;note-640"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-640">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFWortmanMarker2014" class="citation book cs1">Wortman, Richard S.; Marker, Gary (2014). <li id="cite&#95;note-641"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-641">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFBrumfield1989" class="citation journal cs1">Brumfield, William C. (December 1989). "Anti-Modernism and the Neoclassical Revival in Russian Architecture, 19061916". <i><a href="/wiki/Journal_of_the_Society_of_Architectural_Historians" title="Journal of the Society of Architectural Historians">Journal of the Society of Architectural Historians</a></i>. <b>48</b> (4). <li id="cite&#95;note-654"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-654">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theage.com.au/entertainment/music/tatu-bad-to-be-true-20030614-gdvvq0.html">"Tatu bad to be true"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Age" title="The Age">The Age</a></i>. 14 June 2003. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220331103131/https://www.theage.com.au/entertainment/music/tatu-bad-to-be-true-20030614-gdvvq0.html">Archived</a> from the original on 31 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite&#95;note-667"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-667">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFHelen1958" class="citation journal cs1">Helen, Muchnic (1958). </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-668"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-668">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFMcVay1998" class="citation journal cs1">McVay, Gordon (1998). <li id="cite&#95;note-681"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-681">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFBevir1994" class="citation journal cs1">Bevir, Mark (1994). </li>
<li id="cite&#95;note-682"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-682">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKelly1980" class="citation journal cs1">Kelly, Aileen (1980). <li id="cite&#95;note-Volokh-1983-710"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Volokh-1983_710-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Volokh-1983_710-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFVolokhManus1983" class="citation book cs1">Volokh, Anne; Manus, Mavis (1983). <i>The Art of Russian Cuisine</i>. <li id="cite&#95;note-723"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-723">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFGorokhov2015" class="citation journal cs1">Gorokhov, Vitalii Aleksandrovich (2015). Sports Mega-Events as a Venue for Building National Identity". <i><a href="/wiki/Nationalities_Papers" title="Nationalities Papers">Nationalities Papers</a></i>. <b>43</b> (2). <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>: 278. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F00905992.2014.998043">10.1080/00905992.2014.998043</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Nationalities+Papers&amp;rft.atitle=Forward+Russia%21+Sports+Mega-Events+as+a+Venue+for+Building+National+Identity&amp;rft.volume=43&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=278&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F00905992.2014.998043&amp;rft.aulast=Gorokhov&amp;rft.aufirst=Vitalii+Aleksandrovich&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 April</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Social+History+of+Post-Communist+Russia&amp;rft.series=Routledge+Contemporary+Russia+and+Eastern+Europe+Series&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-317-32846-9&amp;rft.aulast=Dutkiewicz&amp;rft.aufirst=P.&amp;rft.au=Richard%2C+S.&amp;rft.au=Vladimir%2C+K.&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dvo7DCwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPP1&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li>Frye, Timothy. <i>Weak Strongman: The Limits of Power in Putin's Russia</i> (2021) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.amazon.com/Weak-Strongman-Limits-Putins-Russia/dp/0691212465/">excerpt</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220331074724/https://www.amazon.com/Weak-Strongman-Limits-Putins-Russia/dp/0691212465">Archived</a> 31 March 2022 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></li>
<li>Greene, by Samuel A. and Graeme B. Robertson. <i>Putin v. the People: the Perilous Politics of a Divided Russia</i> (Yale UP, 2019) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.amazon.com/Putin-v-People-Perilous-Politics/dp/0300238398/">excerpt</a></li>
<li>Hosking, Geoffrey A. <i>Russia and the Russians: a history</i> (2011) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/russiarussianshi2ndehosk">online</a></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFKropotkinBealbyPhillips1911" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a href="/wiki/Peter_Kropotkin" title="Peter Kropotkin">Kropotkin, Peter Alexeivitch</a>; Bealby, John Thomas; <a href="/wiki/Walter_Alison_Phillips" title="Walter Alison Phillips">Phillips, Walter Alison</a> (1911). <span class="cs1-ws-icon" title="s:1911 Encyclopdia Britannica/Russia"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/1911_Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica/Russia">"Russia"&#160;</a></span>. In <a href="/wiki/Hugh_Chisholm" title="Hugh Chisholm">Chisholm, Hugh</a> (ed.). <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica_Eleventh_Edition" title="Encyclopdia Britannica Eleventh Edition">Encyclopdia Britannica</a></i>. Vol.&#160;23 (11th&#160;ed.). Cambridge University Press. pp.&#160;<span class="nowrap">869</span>912.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Russia&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclop%C3%A6dia+Britannica&amp;rft.pages=869-912&amp;rft.edition=11th&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1911&amp;rft.aulast=Kropotkin&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter+Alexeivitch&amp;rft.au=Bealby%2C+John+Thomas&amp;rft.au=Phillips%2C+Walter+Alison&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFPynnniemi2021" class="citation book cs1">Pynnniemi, Katri (2021). Pynnniemi, Katri (ed.). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://hup.fi/books/e/10.33134/HUP-9"><i>Nexus of Patriotism and Militarism in Russia: A Quest for Internal Cohesion</i></a>. Helsinki University Press. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.33134%2FHUP-9">10.33134/HUP-9</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-952-369-035-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-952-369-035-6"><bdi>978-952-369-035-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Nexus+of+Patriotism+and+Militarism+in+Russia%3A+A+Quest+for+Internal+Cohesion&amp;rft.pub=Helsinki+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2021&amp;rft&#95;id=info%3Adoi%2F10.33134%2FHUP-9&amp;rft.isbn=978-952-369-035-6&amp;rft.aulast=Pynn%C3%B6niemi&amp;rft.aufirst=Katri&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fhup.fi%2Fbooks%2Fe%2F10.33134%2FHUP-9&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFRancour-Laferriere1995" class="citation book cs1">Rancour-Laferriere, Daniel (1995). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://opensquare.nyupress.org/books/9780814769409/"><i>The Slave Soul of Russia: Moral Masochism and the Cult of Suffering</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/New_York_University_Press" title="New York University Press">New York University Press</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-6940-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8147-6940-9"><bdi>978-0-8147-6940-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Slave+Soul+of+Russia%3A+Moral+Masochism+and+the+Cult+of+Suffering&amp;rft.pub=New+York+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8147-6940-9&amp;rft.aulast=Rancour-Laferriere&amp;rft.aufirst=Daniel&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fopensquare.nyupress.org%2Fbooks%2F9780814769409%2F&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></li>
<li><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1333433106" /><cite id="CITEREFReiman2016" class="citation book cs1">Reiman, Michael (2016). <i>About Russia, Its Revolutions, Its Development and Its Present</i>. Peter Lang. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-3-631-67136-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-3-631-67136-8"><bdi>978-3-631-67136-8</bdi></a>. <a href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv2t4dn7">j.ctv2t4dn7</a>.</cite><span title="ctx&#95;ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft&#95;val&#95;fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=About+Russia%2C+Its+Revolutions%2C+Its+Development+and+Its+Present&amp;rft.pub=Peter+Lang&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft&#95;id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2Fj.ctv2t4dn7%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.isbn=978-3-631-67136-8&amp;rft.aulast=Reiman&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rfr&#95;id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ARussia" class="Z3988"></span></li>

</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div>
<ul><li><sup>1</sup> Spans the conventional boundary between Europe and another continent.</li>
<li><sup>2</sup> Considered European for cultural, political and historical reasons but is geographically in Western Asia.</li>
<li><sup>3</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
<li><sup>4</sup> Governed by the <a href="/wiki/Holy_See" title="Holy See">Holy See</a> which has sovereignty over Vatican City.</li></ul>
<ul><li><span class="noviewer" typeof="mw:File"><span title="Category"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/20px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png" decoding="async" width="16" height="16" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/40px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 1.5x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="185" /></span></span> <b><a href="/wiki/Category:Europe" title="Category:Europe">Category</a></b></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div>
<ul><li><sup>1</sup> As the "Turkish Cypriot State".</li></ul>
